hedline.hl1: June 16-22;She Makes Nice and Makes It Big

block.p: Rosie O'Donnell didn't believe she was doing anything revolutionary by modeling her new syndicated daytime talk show after the old "Merv Griffin Show" instead of the new "Ricki Lake Show."

But viewers and critics seem to agree that Ms. O'Donnell, with a format that emphasizes jokes and light banter with celebrity guests, has brought a breath of fresh air to what had become a torrid blast of hot air on daytime talk shows.
Rosie O'Donnell didn't believe she was doing anything revolutionary by modeling her new syndicated daytime talk show after the old "Merv Griffin Show" instead of the new "Ricki Lake Show."

But viewers and critics seem to agree that Ms. O'Donnell, with a format that emphasizes jokes and light banter with celebrity guests, has brought a breath of fresh air to what had become a torrid blast of hot air on daytime talk shows.

In ratings the first week, Ms. O'Donnell's show beat Ricki, Geraldo, Jerry Springer and all the other talkmeisters except the Queen, Oprah, who herself has abandoned the trash-wallow format. The biggest compliment to Ms. O'Donnell: syndicators are already scrambling to find the next Rosie-like host.
